Title: Bitter Moon
Description: A cool married couple strike up an unlikely friendship on a cruise liner with wheelchair-bound Peter Coyote, a dissolute writer who takes it upon himself to teach Grant the secrets of the erotic arts so that he can satisfy both Scott-Thomas and Coyote's wife, Emmanuelle Seigner.

Genre.Name: Romance
Genre.Description: The aim of the genre is simple, showcasing a love story where two people overcome adversity to obtain their happily ever after.

Director.Name: Roman Polanski
Director.Bio: Raymond Roman Thierry Polánski is a Polish and French film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor. During his career Polanski has received five Oscar nominations, winning the Best Director in 2003 for The Pianist

Bio: Roman Polanski is a Polish film director, producer, writer and actor. Having made films in Poland, Britain, France and the USA, he is considered one of the few truly international filmmakers.

Title: The Pianist
Description: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: In film and television, drama is a category or genre of narrative fiction (or semi-fiction) intended to be more serious than humorous in tone.

Title: Rosemary's Baby
Description: Waifish Rosemary Woodhouse and her struggling actor husband Guy move to a New York City apartment building with an ominous reputation and odd neighbors Roman and Minnie Castavet (Sidney Blackmer, Ruth Gordon). When Rosemary becomes pregnant she becomes increasingly isolated, and the diabolical truth is revealed only after Rosemary gives birth.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thriller film, also known as suspense film or suspense thriller, is a broad film genre that involves excitement and suspense in the audience.

Director.Name: Roman Polanski
Director.Bio: Raymond Roman Thierry Polánski is a Polish and French film director, producer, screenwriter, and actor. During his career Polanski has received five Oscar nominations, winning the Best Director in 2003 for The Pianist

Title: Chinatown
Description: When Los Angeles private eye J.J. Gittes is hired by Evelyn Mulwray to investigate her husband's activities, he believes it's a routine infidelity case. Jake's investigation soon becomes anything but routine when he meets the real Mrs. Mulwray and realizes he was hired by an imposter. Mr. Mulwray's sudden death sets Gittes on a tangled trail of corruption, deceit and sinister family secrets as Evelyn's father becomes a suspect in the case.

Genre.Name: Thriller

Title: Carnage
Description: When some roughhousing between two 11-year-old boys named Zachary and Ethan erupts into real violence, Ethan loses two teeth. Zachary's parents, Alan and Nancy Cowen, meet with Ethan's parents, Penelope and Michael Longstreet, to try to smooth things over. However, what starts as a polite meeting among adults descends into finger-pointing, tantrums and insults.

Title: An Officer and a Spy
Description: A story about the Dreufeus affair, concerning French captain Alfred Dreyfus who is wrongfully convicted of passing military secrets to the Germans and sentenced to life imprisonment at Devil island.

Title: Venus in Fur
Description: An enigmatic actress may have a hidden agenda when she auditions for a part in a misogynistic writer's play.

Title: Knife in the Water
Description: On their way to an afternoon on the lake, husband and wife Andrzej and Krystyna nearly run over a young hitchhiker. Inviting the young man onto the boat with them, Andrzej begins to subtly torment him; the hitchhiker responds by making overtures toward Krystyna. When the hitchhiker is accidentally knocked overboard, the husband's panic results in unexpected consequences.

Title: Tess
Description: Tess is sent by her alcoholic father to visit her rich relatives and apply for a job. She's taken in and immediately seduced by her cousin, Alec, who leaves her pregnant.

Title: King of Staten Island
Description: A semi-autobiographical comedy-drama about Pete Davidson growing up in Staten Island, including losing his father during 9/11 and entering the world of stand up comedy.
